meanings.definition: A path that diverges from the main road or path.
meanings.sent1: The hikers decided to explore the bypaths through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The bypaths in the park offer a peaceful alternative to the crowded main trails.
meanings.sent3: Lost in the maze of bypaths, they stumbled upon a hidden clearing filled with wildflowers.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts wandered down the bypaths of memory, leading her to nostalgic moments.
meanings.sent5: The bypaths, with their twists and turns, added an element of adventure to the journey.

meanings.definition: To go around or avoid something by taking a different path.
meanings.sent1: We had to bypaths the construction zone to reach the store on time.
meanings.sent2: She chose to bypaths the busy city streets by taking a scenic route along the river.
meanings.sent3: In order to avoid the traffic jam, they decided to bypaths through the smaller streets.
meanings.sent4: He always finds a way to bypaths obstacles and reach his goals.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox was able to bypaths the traps set by the hunters.
